title: (x) wide sans serif on Wallpaper magazine cover - Burin Sans {Stephen}
content:
I am in need of recommendations of typefaces that it's characters are short in height and very long in width.  
Sorry I don't have any examples at the time.  
One I can think of is quite round in it's line form?  
Any ideas?
author: Seadreams

comments.content:
Are you looking for sans or serif? How extended do you want to go? The first options that come to mind are Engravers Gothic/Sackers Gothic/Blair and Trade Gothic Extended.

- Lex

Hey Lex, thanks for your ideas. Blair was the one I was thinking of...  
A sans or serif, just has to be classy! A long extension would be great. Thanks
A long extension...

Wide:  
 [Luxury](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211108/http:/houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=536&subpage=viewfonts)
Wider...
[Flatiron](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211108/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=ITC.100335.0.0)
[Zeppelin](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211108/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-53-zeppelin-complete)

Thanks! I have flatiron, I will test that one out. Zeppelin looks nice also.  
The exact font I am after is similar to flatiron but has rounded lines?  
Anyone know of this one? I know it was used in Wallpaper magazine on a cover? I will try and finf the issue cover...
[Amplitude Wide](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211108/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Amplitude)? The wide cut isn't that wide but it's the face used in Wallpaper.

I don't think that is the one I am after. See attached a pic of the issue of Wallpaper that has the typeface I am after. Sorry about the size, I couldn't find bigger?!  
It's the one that says 'Build a better life'. Anything similar to this or even wider would be perfect!
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211108im_/http:/typophile.com/files/wallpaper_front_3511.jpg)

Hmm this isn't it but what about [Titling Gothic FB Wide](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211108/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/TitlingGothicFB/)?

The abovementioned Zeppelin is close to your sample.
Thanks Geoff, close... any other ideas

That sample looks like Sackers Gothic.

Zeppelin would have been my suggestion - it gives you lots of options.

Akzidenz Grotesk has a good extended too.

Vienna Extended

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/vienna-extended/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211108/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/vienna-extended/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/vienna-extended/")

Betique

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfprimegraphics/betique/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211108/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfprimegraphics/betique/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfprimegraphics/betique/")

[FF QType](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211108/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.11438.0.0)  
 [Cavalero](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211108/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=BT.122647.0.0)

Thanks for the suggestions. Stephen, I liked your options. I still really want to find out that typeface on the wallpaper cover. Pattyfab, definitely close with Sackers Gothic but slightly different. Anyone????

Ahh, that looks like it was [back in the day](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211108/http:/typographi.com/000490.php) when they were using [Burin Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211108/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=C.2780.3.5).
Thanks so much!!
You can always count on Stewf to save the day. ;^)
